scenarioDescription:
The HD 38283 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 38283 is a star with 1.37 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.49 times its radius. It is located 124.14 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 6.2 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 38283 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 38283 system


HD 38283 b

HD 38283 b was discovered by the Anglo-Australian Telescope observatory, in 2011-05, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 38283 b is 127.200 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 38283 b is 14.000 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 38283 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 38283, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Anglo-Australian Telescope.
name: HD 38283 - System With 1 Exoplanet
